title: Clubber, 20, wakes up more than 100 miles from home after £400 drunken Uber ride
text:

A tired clubber ended up more than 100 miles from home after falling asleep in his Uber.

Joseph Fergie hopped in a cab on his way back from an enjoyable night out at ATIK nightclub in Edinburgh on Friday.

He keyed in the Uber destination and then fell asleep in the back of the car, The Daily Record reported .

At 8.30am the call centre worker was woken from his slumber by the driver who explained that they had arrived.

The 20-year-old took a bleary eyed look around and realised he had been brought to the wrong location.

(Image: Twitter)

(Image: Twitter)

“I woke up still drunk and when I saw sheep kicking about the countryside - I thought the guy had taken me to Musselburgh ," Joseph.

He quickly discovered the cab driver had taken him to Kirkcudbright in the Borders - more than 100 miles from his home.

Joseph turned to Snapchat to share news of his expensive blunder, which had cost close to £400 by that point.

“I ended up telling all my pals about the situation and they just burst out laughing," he said.

"They couldn’t believe what happened."

At the end of a frantic search for routes home on his low battery phone and a journey involving several buses and a train, Joseph made it home.

(Image: Twitter)

A full 12 hours after the club shut its doors.

“I’m still trying to piece together what exactly happened last night and I am chatting with Uber to see if they can help in any way," he added.

“I’ve had never heard of Kirkcudbright before last night and I doubt I’ll be able to ever forget it now.”
description: Joseph Fergie finally got home 12 hours after he left ATIK nightclub in Edinburgh
